issue.title: Google Play: com.vkontakte.android
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.vkontakte.android&hl=ru](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fplay.google.com%2Fstore%2Fapps%2Fdetails%3Fid%3Dcom.vkontakte.android%26hl%3Dru) ### Comment > С недавних пор стала замечать, что на телефоне в приложении ВК (и в других соц сетях) стала появляться реклама. При чем на компьютере в ленте ВК нет рекламы , AdGuard работает отлично, видимо). А вот на смартфоне проскакивает. В ленте новостей 2-3,иногда 4 поста , потом реклама идёт , далее снова 3-4поста и снова реклама. Может что-то в настройках AdGuard сбилось после обновления или дополнительно надо что-то включить, чтобы не было таких рекламных постоа.Подскажите, пожалуйста)) Username: `@Татьяна ` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/3v9b38rbfim8g48wosgokks8gww0ws0cvl95vfwr34.jpg?nc=1)

comment.body:
Does it work if add:
```adblock
superpsx.com#@#.google-ad
```
to user rules?

Also, do you have only `AdGuard Base filter`, `AdGuard Mobile Ads filter`, `EasyList` filter lists enabled (like mentioned in the report)?
By the way, `EasyList` is included in `AdGuard Base filter` so it can be disabled.

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try leave only AdGuard filters without `AdGuard Mobile Ads`, update them (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: nytimes.com broken, dom filter prevent clicking links

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.61.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.nytimes.com/

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. The website display correctly, but interactivity is broken. For instance, the homepage display everything as expected, include headlines, pictures, etc, but it's impossible to click on headlines and other links. 

A filter prevent dismissing a pop-up. Links are inactive until the user dismiss the popup. 

Using uBlock origin's debug tools, I'm able to blame the following esthetic filter.

Filter: `nytimes.com###complianceOverlay`
Filter type: dom
Filter list: AdGuard Annoyances filter

2. Screenshots: none. The issue is non-visual. 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
IMO rule is bad, click under pop-up is disabled without `trusted-click-element` form list "uBo Cookie Notices".

If they use the <dialog> tag, consider using:

```adb
nytimes.com#$##complianceOverlay { remove: true }
```

When simple JS or CSS is used to freeze clicks and touches, uAsset together with ELC may be playing it safe and prefer clicking over periodically verifying the operation of filters to annoyance.

labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: In progress

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/187851

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. The website display correctly, but interactivity is broken. For instance, the homepage display everything as expected, include headlines, pictures, etc, but it's impossible to click on headlines and other links. 

A filter prevent dismissing a pop-up. Links are inactive until the user dismiss the popup. 

Using uBlock origin's debug tools, I'm able to blame the following esthetic filter.

Filter: `nytimes.com###complianceOverlay`
Filter type: dom
Filter list: AdGuard Annoyances filter

2. Screenshots: none. The issue is non-visual. 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
The issue is caused by `Polish Annoyances Filters`
```
|http*://*.*$document,domain=~0.0.0.0|~127.0.0.1|~[::1]|~[::]|~local|~localhost|~stooq.com|~stooq.pl,permissions=autoplay=() (
```
@krystian3w Hello. Could you please take a look?

comment.body:
OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/196308#issue-2785578968

Not an ad, please add this rule to the user rules:

```
tripadvisor.com.au#?##typeahead_results button + hr + a[href]:has(> div[class] > div[class] > div[class]:contains(Sponsored))
```

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS

### AdGuard version

0.107.55

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
